meanings.definition: To manipulate or rub muscles and skin to relieve tension or pain.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she massaged her sore shoulders to relax.
meanings.sent2: The massage therapist massaged the client's back to ease the tension.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he could be a professional shoulder massager after how well he massaged his friend's shoulders.
meanings.sent4: The soothing music and gentle touch of the massage therapist massaged away all her stress.
meanings.sent5: The warm oil and skilled hands of the masseuse massaged out all the knots in her muscles.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or alter information or data in a way that presents it in a more favorable light.
meanings.sent1: The PR team massaged the numbers to make the company's performance look better.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was carefully massaged to appeal to a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The student massaged the facts in his report to make his argument more convincing.
meanings.sent4: The photographer skillfully massaged the lighting to enhance the beauty of the model.
meanings.sent5: The editor massaged the article to make it more engaging for the readers.
